page.title: 16HISTORIC HOUSES BURY/H'TON 2
page.content: There are many other old houses, the oldest being Bury Church which was probably started in the latter part of the 12th Century. Houghton church is also a very old building started circa late 12th Century. The 3 inns are all over 400 years old, the White Horse and the Black Dog and Duck both in Bury; and the George and Dragon in Houghton which sheltered Charles II from Cromwell's soldiers. The 2 farmhouses in houghton are also very old, one dating back to the 14th Century whilst the other was built in the 16th Century. Additionaly, there are some dozen or so other houses in Bury privately owned dating back to the 16th Century, including 4 listed buildings and a few of like vintage in Houghton. Many of these houses are built of flint stones and some being still thatched.
